NEWS RELEASE: North Davis Preparatory Academy Arts Bridge Class Celebrates Exploration of Identity through Mask Making and Photography

LAYTON, UTAH ‚Äì Students and faculty at North Davis Preparatory Academy (NDPA) traveled to Antelope Island to experience landscape, light, and photography while exploring their own mask creations as they relate to their own individual and cultural identity.

After studying masks historically with Ms. Hollie Draney (history) and learning photographic elements with Ms. Portia Snow (professional photographer), students created their own masks with Ms. Erinne Roundy (art).

In the weeks to come, students will learn from Ms. Amanda King (language arts) about writing their story. Students will combine their ‚Äúbridged‚Äù knowledge and work to express themselves with the written word, the construction of props and the elements of photography.

Watch for exhibits at upcoming Fine Arts nights, local displays in the community, and a potential collaboration with Antelope Islands Visitor Center.
